intro: Ouratea subvelutina, commonly known as the velvet ouratea, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Ochnaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture, giving it its common name. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds.
